Pre-Game Insights: Chad aim for their first win in Group G of the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers as they face reigning champions Ivory Coast.
Ivory Coast’s dominance in possession: They dominated their opening match against Zambia with 69% possession, significantly higher than Chad’s 36% against Sierra Leone.
Chad’s struggles in front of goal: They managed only 1 shot on target in their last match, despite firing off 19 shots in total.
Ivory Coast’s high-volume attack: They produced 22 shots in their last outing, 7 of which were on target, with players like Jean-Philippe Krasso and Simon Adingra in top form.
Ivory Coast’s strong defense: They have not conceded in their last two matches and have kept a solid defensive structure.
